summary: Leukotriene B4 (LTB4) is a specific type of carbon compound, classified as a lipid mediator and part of the eicosanoid family, which consists of bioactive compounds containing 20 carbon atoms. It is synthesized from arachidonic acid, a carbon compound stored in membrane phospholipids, highlighting its role in inflammatory processes. Thus, LTB4 exemplifies the functional significance of carbon compounds in biological systems.
